shapes3d

Class Shape3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • shapes3d.Shape3D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PConstants, SConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Anchor, Box, Cone, Mesh2DCore, Terrain, Xshape

    public abstract class Shape3D
extends Object
implements PConstants, SConstants
    Abstract class - the base for all 3D shape classes.
    Provides functionality to control position, rotation, color and draw mode of the various shapes available in this library.
    See drawMode(int mode) for details on the draw modes available.
    This class supports the selection of a 3D shape at a given x/y screen position. It uses a colour picking algorithm where each object is drawn with a unique colour ignoring lighting and surface normals. The colour at the x/y screen position can then be used to identify the shape. this is done by calling -
    pickShape(PApplet papplet, int x, int y)

    The first time the setTexure(...) method is called with a particular filename will result in the image being loaded and cached. Subsequent calls with the saved filename will use the cached image. This means that only one image per file exists in RAM.
    Author:
    Peter Lager

    • Field Detail

      • tag

        public String tag
        User defined tag for this shape.
        This can be any text the user likes or finds useful. When a shape is created this is initialised to the name of the class e.g. Toroid, Cone etc.

      • tagNo

        public int tagNo
        User defined tag number.
        This can be any number the user likes or finds useful.

        public static PImage img

    • Method Detail

      • setOptimizedStrokeOn

        public static void setOptimizedStrokeOn(boolean on)
        By default Processing optimizes stroke drawing to reduce execution time. Unfortunately this can cause visual artifacts to appear to avoid these set this to false to disable stroke optimization (but at the expanse of speed). There is no impact if stroke darwing mode is unused.
        Parameters:
        on - false to avoid visual artufacts

      • isOptimizedStrokeOn

        public static boolean isOptimizedStrokeOn()

      • draw

        public abstract void draw()

      • pickShape

        public static Shape3D pickShape(PApplet papplet,
                int x,
                int y)
        Identify the 3D shape which is under the 2D screen pixel position given by [x,y]
        It does this by using a P3D off-screen buffer, copying the transformation matrices from the PApplet then draws each shape with a unique colour. The colour at position x,y then identifies the 3D shape displayed at that position.
        Since the buffer must copy the current state of the transformation matrices it is best that this is called from the draw method.
        IMPORTANT: the very first call to this method will return null.
        Parameters:
        papplet - the main class that extends PApplet
        x - the x pixel position
        y - the y pixel position
        Returns:
        reference to the selected shape or null if not over a shape

        public static void drawAll()
        Draw all shapes that have been created.

      • shapeOrientation

        public void shapeOrientation(PVector up,
                    PVector centreOfRot)
        Change the world position and up direction for a new centre of rotation.
        If these are different from existing values then recalculate the shape.
        Parameters:
        up -
        centreOfRot -

        public void addShape(Shape3D shape)
        Adds a shape as a child shape. If the shape already has a parent it is removed from that parent.
        It is the reverse of removeShape.
        Parameters:
        shape - the shape to add

      • drawMode

        public void drawMode(int mode)
        Sets the draw mode for the shape.
        The three constants Shape3D.SOILD, Shape3D.WIRE and Shape3D.TEXTURE are used to determine how the shape is drawn. These can be or-ed together to get different drawing combinations e.g. Shape3D.SOLID | Shape3D.WIRE would be a coloured shape with edges. If the parameter is Shape3D.TEXTURE then and a texture has not been set then it will use SOLID.
        Parameters:
        mode -

      • drawMode

        public void drawMode(int mode,
            int parts)
        This method is overridden in the classes that have multiple parts e.g. Cone, Tube and Helix
        Parameters:
        mode -
        parts -

      • drawMode

        public int drawMode()
        Get the draw mode
        Returns:
        Shape3D.SOILD, Shape3D.WIRE or Shape3D.TEXTURE

      • adjustToTerrain

        public void adjustToTerrain(Terrain t,
                   int tMode,
                   float heightAbove)
        Will adjust the shape's position to ensure that it is over the terrain at a given height above it.
        Parameters:
        t - the terrain we want to use
        tMode - Terrain.CLAMP or Terrain.WRAP
        heightAbove - the height of the eye above the terrain

      • pickColor

        public boolean pickColor(int pcol)
        Set the pick colour for this shape.
        Included for those rare occasions when you might want to set your own pick colour. It enforces the rule that the pick colour is unique for each shape, so if you specify an existing colour no changes are made and the method returns false. It returns true if the pick colour was changed successfully.
        Parameters:
        pcol - the new pick color

      • pickColor

        public int pickColor()
        Get the pick colour for this shape
        Returns:
        the pick color value

      • strokeWeight

        Parameters:

      • finishedWith

        public void finishedWith()
        If you have finished with a shape call this method to remove it from the list of shapes to draw / pick.
        This enables garbage collection to release memory allocated to this shape.
